result.execSummary:
The defendant Jerid E. HANSON was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess Drug Paraphernalia to Manufacture Methamphetamine, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(3)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: consecutive to the revocation time defendant is currently serving in 07 CF 179 and 07 CF 285.

miscConds.notes: If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
Maintain full-time employment or job search in the alternative.

Pay supervision fees in an amount to be determined by the Department of Corrections.

Submit to random urine screens and pay for same.

Assessment, treatment, counseling as deemed appropriate by the Department's assessment process.

Provide DNA sample.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

supervisions.notes: Consecutive to the sentence imposed on 10 CF 291.

superMiscConds.notes: If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

Pay supervision fees in an amount to be determined by the Department of Corrections.

Submit to random urine screens and pay for same.

Maintain absolute sobriety..

Assessment, treatment, counseling as deemed appropriate by the Department's assessment process.
Maintain full-time employment, schooling or a combination of both.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea
